intro: Biscutella alpicola, commonly known as the alpine biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Biscutella alpicola is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes.
